channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Team New Zealand denies allegations in MBIE investigation
item.description: Team New Zealand denies allegations of financial impropriety brought against it by former employees, who were sacked after claims of spying.

item.title: Coronial inquest clears staff of wrongdoing in Samuel Fischer's suicide
item.description: An inquest into the suicide of a man while at a mental health unit in Wellington has cleared the staff of any wrongdoing.

item.title: Weather: Chilly morning, snow on the way
item.description: Snow is on the way for alpine passes in the South Island and parts of the central North Island.

item.title: Juniper hunt seedlings could grow NZs first gin berry plantation
item.description: New Zealand is one step closer to establishing the country's first plantation of Juniperus communis - whose berries are the key ingredient of gin - following a nationwide search for the elusive conifer.

item.title: PhD candidate says some post-grad students should be let in as essential workers
item.description: International students won't be coming back to NZ universities next semester, and that isn't sitting well with some.

item.title: Tahr Foundation and Forest and Bird butt heads over culling
item.description: The Department of Conservation has been caught in the crossfire as hunters and conservationists fight over its proposed tahr culling programme.

item.title: WorkSafe investigators under pressure, lack training - report
item.description: An independent report into WorkSafe has found multiple failings in the way the agency investigates deaths and injuries on the job.

item.title: Construction on $62m Matakana Link Road project under way
item.description: Construction has started on a four-lane road in Warkworth, which is expected to relieve major congestion.

item.title: Research team given $5m to study NZ's old, cold, mouldy homes
item.description: A long-running project to tackle problem housing has received $5 million from the Health Research Council, which has handed out $71 million for 47 studies in its latest funding round.

item.title: New Zealand government sat on Palantir Covid-19 data tracking offer
item.description: Emails released to RNZ show a US offer to rapidly set up Covid-19 data-crunching capabilities sat with the government for more than a month during the lockdown.

item.title: Team New Zealand 'leaks' investigated by MBIE
item.description: Emirates Team New Zealand and America's Cup Event Ltd have axed people they describe as informants, while MBIE is investigating the alleged leaks.

item.title: Bloomfield to meet Air NZ chief exec over hotel rules for staff
item.description: Health officials are reviewing the rules which allow international airline crew to stay at hotels during layovers which are also used by the public.

item.title: Ōtautau teen jailed at least 11 years for murder of 9yo
item.description: An Ōtautau teenager will spend at least 11 years behind bars for the murder of nine-year-old boy Hunter MacIntosh.

item.title: Mosque shooter interview should not be public, attack witness says
item.description: A witness to the 15 March mosque attacks says an interview with the shooter should not be made public.

item.title: Wellington commuters face long waits after SH2 slip
item.description: All northbound roads out of Wellington ground to a standstill this evening causing commuter chaos, as a result of a traffic log-jam caused by a slip on SH2 near Petone.

item.title: Gang member escapes custody at Auckland District Court
item.description: The Auckland District Court allowed a patched gang member to escape custody today after he said he was a different person and left the premises.

item.title: DHB failed to follow up 'red flag' symptoms of cancer
item.description: The Waitematā District Health Board has been asked to apologise after failing to identify a woman's red-flag symptoms despite her history with breast cancer.

item.title: Pilot defends abilities in inquest six years after crash
item.description: The pilot of a helicopter that crashed near Wanaka - killing a man - has defended his training and abilities in a coronial inquest.
